dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
A high energy physics software package for jet finding in pp and e+e-
collisions.
dependencies.name: fastjet

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
The HepMC package is an object oriented, C++ event record for High
Energy Physics Monte Carlo generators and simulation.
dependencies.name: hepmc

dependencies.description:
The HepMC package is an object oriented, C++ event record for High
Energy Physics Monte Carlo generators and simulation.
dependencies.name: hepmc3

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.
dependencies.name: py-cython

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependencies.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.
dependencies.name: swig

dependencies.description: YODA - Yet more Objects for Data Analysis
dependencies.name: yoda

dependent_to.description:
The Pythia program is a standard tool for the generation of events in
high-energy collisions, comprising a coherent set of physics models for
the evolution from a few-body hard process to a complex multiparticle
final state.
dependent_to.name: pythia8

dependent_to.description:
Sherpa is a Monte Carlo event generator for the Simulation of High-
Energy Reactions of PArticles in lepton-lepton, lepton-photon, photon-
photon, lepton-hadron and hadron-hadron collisions.
dependent_to.name: sherpa

dependent_to.description: Toolkit for High Energy Physics Event Generation
dependent_to.name: thepeg

description: Rivet - the particle-physics MC analysis toolkit
name: rivet

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
